diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Cholelithiasis with probable choledocholithiasis, Biliary colic, Incidentally liver mass focal nodular hyperplasia
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with sharp epigastric and right lower quadrant pain, along with nausea and decreased oral intake, which are consistent with gallstone pancreatitis. The ERCP findings showed filling defects in the common bile duct, suggesting the presence of gallstones, supporting the diagnosis.
